item.title: 高通公司为人工智能改造手机芯片，与三星等公司签约
item.description: 高通公司（Qualcomm）周一表示，它正在将最初为笔记本电脑芯片开发的技术应用到手机芯片中，目的是使这些芯片在执行人工智能生成任务时性能更强。【原文：Qualcomm said on Monday it is bringing technology first developed for its laptop chips to its mobile phone chips, aiming to make them more powerful for generative AI tasks.】

item.title: 神秘海外账户在 Polymarket 博彩网站上增加了对特朗普的投标
item.description: 据Polymarket的活动跟踪器显示，Polymarket上有四个账户因大量下注特朗普胜选而引发猜测，其中一个账户下了更大的赌注，将特朗普胜选时的集体潜在赔付额从周五的3000万美元增加到周一上午的近4300万美元。【原文：One of the four accounts on Polymarket that have fueled speculation over their large bets on a Trump election victory has taken even bigger wagers, increasing the collective potential payout if Trump wins from $30 million on Friday to nearly $43 million Monday morning, according to Polymarket's activity tracker.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 100 万美元选举赠品考验了选举法的极限
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）向签署其言论自由和枪支权利请愿书的选民赠送的 100 万美元属于选举法的灰色地带，法律专家们对这位唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的亿万富翁支持者是否会触犯禁止付钱让人登记投票的规定存在分歧。【原文：Elon Musk’s $1 million giveaway for voters who sign his free-speech and gun-rights petition falls into a gray area of election law, and legal experts are divided about whether the billionaire supporter of Donald Trump could be running afoul of prohibitions on paying people to register to vote.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利：就业市场意外疲软可能引发对降息步伐的重新思考
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周一重申，他预计未来几个季度将 "适度 "降息，但劳动力市场的急剧疲软可能会促使他主张加快降息步伐。 "卡什卡利在奇佩瓦福尔斯地区商会（Chippewa Falls Area Chamber of Co）举行的市政厅会议上说："如果劳动力市场出人意料地疲软，这将促使我重新审视我的'点'。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank President Neel Kashkari on Monday repeated he expects "modest" interest-rate cuts over the coming quarters, though a sharp weakening of labor markets could move him to advocate for faster rate cuts. "If the labor market weakens surprisingly, that would cause me to take a fresh look at my 'dots,'" Kashkari said in a town hall at the Chippewa Falls Area Chamber of Co】

item.title: 墨西哥 10 月上半月总体通胀率上升，核心通胀率下降：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，墨西哥的总体通胀可能在10月上半月加速，而核心通胀则继续放缓，这增强了人们对墨西哥央行将继续下调基准利率的预期。【原文：Headline inflation in Mexico probably accelerated in the first half of October, while its core measure continued to ease, a Reuters poll showed on Monday, reinforcing expectations that the central bank will continue cutting its benchmark interest rate.】

item.title: 研究称，资产管理公司将迎来日益萧条的几年
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，资产管理公司的盈利能力在过去两年里有所下滑，而且随着投资者越来越多地选择交易所交易基金（ETF）等费用较低的产品，到2028年可能会进一步下降。【原文：Profitability at asset managers has slipped for the past two years and is likely to decline further through 2028 as investors increasingly opt for products with lower fees, such as exchange-traded funds (ETFs), according to a new study.】

item.title: 贝莱德的芬克看好美国高赤字下的私人市场
item.description: 贝莱德公司首席执行官兼董事长拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）说，私人市场的发展可以减轻美国巨额赤字和高额政府债务对经济的影响。【原文：The growth of private markets could mitigate the economic impact of wide U.S. deficits and high government debt levels, said Larry Fink, CEO and chairman at BlackRock.】

item.title: 默多克旗下道琼斯和《纽约邮报》起诉 Perplexity AI 公司
item.description: 媒体大亨鲁珀特-默多克（Rupert Murdoch）旗下的道琼斯公司和《纽约邮报》周一对 Perplexity AI 提起诉讼，称这家人工智能初创公司 "大量非法复制 "其版权作品。【原文：Media baron Rupert Murdoch's Dow Jones and New York Post filed a lawsuit against Perplexity AI on Monday, claiming the AI startup engages in a "massive amount of illegal copying" of their copyrighted work.】

item.title: 美国议员质疑石油服务公司SLB对俄罗斯制裁的例外情况
item.description: 来自两党的数十名美国众议员敦促拜登政府加强对俄罗斯石油运输的制裁，并对世界最大的油田公司 SLB 在俄罗斯的例外经营权提出质疑。【原文：Dozens of U.S. Representatives from both political parties urged the Biden administration to toughen sanctions on Russian oil shipments and questioned an exception issued to the world's largest oilfield company SLB to operate in the country.】

item.title: 独家报道墨西哥新政府酝酿税收优惠政策吸引外国公司
item.description: 墨西哥一位高级贸易官员在接受采访时表示，墨西哥正在考虑针对电动汽车（EV）、半导体、稀土矿、电池和电子行业提供税收减免，以吸引外国企业在国内投资和生产。【原文：Mexico is considering tax credits to attract foreign firms to invest and produce domestically, targeted at electric vehicle (EV), semiconductor, rare earth minerals, battery and electronics sectors, a top Mexican trade official said in an interview.】

item.title: 美国即将遏制对华人工智能投资
item.description: 美国政府发布的一份公告显示，美国禁止在中国投资人工智能领域的某些规定正在接受最后审查，这表明这些限制措施即将出台。【原文：U.S. rules that will ban certain U.S. investments in artificial intelligence in China are under final review, according to a government posting, suggesting the restrictions are coming soon.】

item.title: 美国将向 Hemlock Semiconductor 提供 3.25 亿美元用于多晶硅生产
item.description: 美国商务部周一表示，计划向 Hemlock Semiconductor 公司拨款 3.25 亿美元，用于大幅提高半导体级多晶硅的生产能力，以改变芯片供应链。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department said Monday it plans to award $325 million to Hemlock Semiconductor to significantly expand production capacity of semiconductor-grade polysilicon as it seeks to shift the chips supply chain.】

item.title: 市场强劲，马士基上调利润展望
item.description: 丹麦航运集团 A.P. 穆勒-马士基（A.P. Moller-Maersk）周一表示，由于第三季度业绩强劲、需求旺盛以及红海航运中断持续，该公司上调了全年利润、收入和现金流预期。【原文：Danish shipping group A.P. Moller-Maersk said on Monday it had raised its full-year profit, revenue and cash flow forecasts on the back of strong third quarter results, strong demand and the continuation of the Red Sea shipping disruption.】

item.title: 杜嘉班纳首席执行官未来可能考虑首次公开募股，现在的首要任务是做强业务
item.description: 意大利奢侈品集团 Dolce & Gabbana 首席执行官周一表示，Dolce & Gabbana 还没有做好首次公开募股的准备，但准备在未来考虑。【原文：Dolce & Gabbana is not ready for an initial public offering but is prepared to consider it in the future, the Italian luxury group's chief executive said on Monday.】

item.title: 研究显示，如果三分之一的劳动力接受人工智能培训，葡萄牙的生产力将得到提高
item.description: 周一的一项研究显示，葡萄牙必须重新培训 130 万名工人（约占其就业人口的 30%）使用生成式人工智能工作，才能在 2030 年之前缩小与欧盟平均生产率的差距。【原文：Portugal must retrain 1.3 million workers, or around 30% of its employed population, to work with generative artificial intelligence in order to close the productivity gap with the European Union's average by 2030, a study showed on Monday.】

item.title: 多头锁定新纪录，黄金魅力扩散
item.description: 分析师表示，随着地缘政治局势紧张、美国大选激烈角逐以及有利的宏观背景吸引了更多投资者，黄金正在延续连续创新高的态势，每盎司3,000美元的心理里程碑也渐行渐近。【原文：Gold is extending a period of successive record highs, moving the psychological milestone of $3,000 per ounce into view, analysts said, as geopolitical tension, a tight U.S. electoral race and favorable macro backdrop attract more investors.】

item.title: 对冲基金在股市中支持 "特朗普交易"，摩根大通称
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）上周末在一份分析提名前定位如何变化的报告中称，全球对冲基金对共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得大选后可能表现良好的股票表现出 "强烈偏好"。【原文：Global hedge funds have shown "a strong preference" for stocks that could perform well if Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump wins the election, JPMorgan said in a note late last week analyzing how positioning is changing ahead of the nomination.】

item.title: 延长债务再融资期限，精神航空股价大涨 46
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）与信用卡处理商达成协议，将债务再融资期限延长两个月至 12 月 23 日，该公司股价周一大涨 46%。【原文：Shares of Spirit Airlines surged as much as 46% on Monday after the ultra low-cost carrier reached a deal with its credit card processor to extend a debt refinancing deadline by two months until Dec. 23.】

item.title: 据 Vedomosti 报道，尽管存在安全隐患，但俄罗斯政府的 iPhone 购买量仍在上升
item.description: 据《Vedomosti》日报周一报道，尽管某些官员被禁止使用苹果设备，但俄罗斯政府 1 月至 9 月的 iPhone 购买量仍比 2023 年同期高出四倍。【原文：The Russian government's purchases of iPhones for January through September were four times higher than the same period in 2023, the Vedomosti daily reported on Monday, despite certain officials being banned from using Apple devices.】

item.title: 霍尼韦尔与谷歌合作，将数据与生成式人工智能相结合
item.description: 霍尼韦尔（Honeywell）与谷歌（Google）周一表示，双方已签署协议，将人工智能技术与其工业数据相连接，以期为客户提供简化的自主操作。【原文：Honeywell has signed a deal with Google to connect artificial intelligence technology with its industrial data, both companies said on Monday, with a view to offer streamlined autonomous operations for its customers.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长强调通胀预期的 "巨大 "脱锚效应
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）强调了该国通胀预期的 "巨大 "脱锚现象，并补充说，使通胀率回归目标 "非常重要"，而决策者们正致力于实现这一目标。【原文：Brazil's central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto highlighted a "huge" deanchoring of inflation expectations in the country, adding that it is "very important" to bring inflation back to target, and that policymakers are committed to doing so.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，摩根大通重新聘用科学家萨拉-卡普尼克（Sarah Kapnick）推动气候发展
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份内部备忘录，摩根大通重新聘用了科学家萨拉-卡普尼克（Sarah Kapnick）为其企业和投资银行客户提供咨询，因为这家华尔街巨头正在加强其气候咨询产品。【原文：JPMorgan Chase has rehired scientist Sarah Kapnick to advise its corporate and investment banking clients, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday, as the Wall Street giant ramps up its climate advisory offerings.】

item.title: 最高法院驳回对美国消费者监督机构领导人工作保护的质疑
item.description: 美国最高法院周一拒绝听取保守派对联邦消费品安全监督机构领导人的工作保护提出的质疑，此案本可以让大法官们有机会重新评估 1935 年的一个先例，即限制总统解雇某些机构负责人的能力。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court declined on Monday to hear a conservative challenge to job protections for the leaders of the federal consumer product safety watchdog in a case that would have given the justices a chance to reassess a 1935 precedent that limits a president's ability to fire certain agency heads.】

item.title: 油价上周下跌 7% 后收复失地
item.description: 周一油价上涨，收复了上周超过 7% 的跌幅，原因是对世界第一大石油进口国中国需求的担忧，以及对中东潜在供应中断的担忧有所缓解。【原文：Oil prices rose on Monday, recouping some of last week's more than 7% decline on worries about demand in China, the world's top oil importer, and easing concerns about potential supply disruptions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行在美国推出数字银行，以获得更低廉的汽车贷款资金
item.description: 西班牙桑坦德银行（Santander）美国首席执行官蒂姆-温尼斯（Tim Wennes）告诉路透社，该公司周一在美国推出了数字银行，这将有助于该公司为超过 300 亿美元的汽车贷款资产提供资金，并拓宽其在美国的零售业务。【原文：Spain's Santander launched its digital bank in the United States on Monday, which will help it to fund over $30 billion of auto lending assets and broaden its retail business in the country, U.S. CEO Tim Wennes told Reuters.】

item.title: 美联储主席洛根：在削减更多资产负债表的同时，关注更多渐进式降息措施
item.description: 达拉斯联邦储备银行行长洛里-洛根（Lorie Logan）周一表示，她认为央行未来还会有更多的降息举措，并表示她认为美联储没有理由不继续缩减资产负债表。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Lorie Logan said Monday she sees more rate cuts ahead for the central bank and suggested she sees no reasons why the Fed can’t also press forward with shrinking its balance sheet.】

item.title: 独家报道欧盟将为关键矿产联合采购平台选择公司
item.description: 文件显示，欧盟正急于建立一个价值 900 万欧元的关键矿产和能源联合采购机制，欧盟正在八家竞标者中做出选择，以开发一个平台，直接知情人士告诉路透社。【原文：The European Union, rushing to develop a 9 million euro joint purchasing mechanism for critical minerals and energy, is choosing between eight bidders vying to develop a platform, documents showed and sources with direct knowledge told Reuters.】

item.title: 迪士尼任命詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）为新董事长，将于 2026 年初宣布下一任首席执行官人选
item.description: 华特迪士尼周一表示，已任命詹姆斯-戈尔曼（James Gorman）为董事会主席，自 1 月 2 日起生效，接替在公司任职 9 年后离职的马克-帕克（Mark Parker）。【原文：Walt Disney said on Monday it has named James Gorman as chairman of the board, effective Jan. 2, replacing Mark Parker, who is leaving the company after nine years.】

item.title: 尼日利亚未能批准壳牌向复兴公司出售资产
item.description: 尼日利亚上游监管机构周一表示，尼日利亚未能批准壳牌将其在尼日尔三角洲地区的全部陆上和浅水石油天然气出售给复兴公司。【原文：Nigeria has failed to approve the sale of Shell's entire onshore and shallow-water oil and gas in the Niger Delta region to Renaissance, the country's upstream regulator said on Monday.】

item.title: Northvolt 在获得一揽子融资计划方面取得进展
item.description: 瑞典电池制造商 Northvolt 周一告诉路透社，该公司在筹集新的一揽子融资计划方面正在取得重大进展。【原文：Swedish battery maker Northvolt is making significant progress towards raising a new financing package, it told Reuters on Monday.】
